result.execSummary:
The defendant Angeline E Brezovar was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court
Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes: Restitution is to be paid joint and several with co-actors.  To be paid to Harley Davidson as a Condtion of Probation and to be paid within the first 9 months of probation.

Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
AODA assesment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
No contact with Harley Davidson.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) with all Standard Release Conditions.
STAYED - to be used at Agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt:
District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Angeline E Brezovar in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.   

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.



Court orders the following:
125 Days in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
STAYED.

Term of Probation:  1 Year.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
No contact with:  Harley Davidson
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).


RESTITUTION:  $780 joint/serveral with co-actors (to be paid to Harley Davidson - to be paid first then costs/fines) - to be paid within first 9 months of probation.
Costs:  $243
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME: 
 30 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
STAYED - To be used at agent's discretion.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Angeline E Brezovar in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.
Repeater enhancer is struck.

Matter put over for sentencing to allow for victim notification.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 09:45 am.

Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Angeline E Brezovar in court with attorney Mark Kershek.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Angeline E Brezovar in court with attorney Joseph Smith.  
File not called on the record.
  Hearing scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness or the Harley Davidson plant listed in the Criminal Complaint.    Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

Defendant Angeline E Brezovar in court.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.    Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 10:30 am.
